channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bayswater Road Park side opposite junction of Albion Street, city of Westminster Street sign stickered, 19th August
item.description:
Location is on Bayswater Road Park side opposite junction of Albion Street. ' Bayswater Road ' street sign stickered

item.title: Fly Tipping in Public Driveway, 19th August
item.description:
Fly tipping has been here for over a month and not been collected despite multiple reports over the phone. Others are seeing it as a landfill site and dump rubbish in there due to the copious amounts of rubbish already there. I cannot move these items.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous hedges on canal path, 19th August
item.description:
Have seen people go into the canal as a result of these, very narrow part of the canal so lack of space is becoming dangerous. Hedges everywhere else seem to be getting cut back but not these

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northiam Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping wood boards with nails hillcourt Road, 19th August
item.description:
Builders and/or removers have been continuously dumping waste. Wooden boards with exposed nails have been left outside for a long time, creating a real hazard for children. Could we please arrange for this to be removed, or at the very least kept inside, to protect children and keep the area safe and clean?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillcourt Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is overhanging onto the pavement and is very high, 19th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frankswood Avenue, Petts Wood, London

item.title: Fly tipping furniture waste HILLCOURT road, 19th August
item.description:
This wood furniture has been dumped and left to rot out in the streets for months. It’s making the area look neglected and is a potential trip hazard for running children. Is there anything we can do to remove it? Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillcourt Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges encroaching onto pathway and becoming a hub for litter, 19th August
item.description:

item.title: Several dumped wheelie bins and scattered rubbish near the junction of Pelton Road and Colomb Street, 19th August
item.description:
These dustbins have been dumped on the road. They are not assigned to any properties. They are overflowing with dumped rubbish, now littering the pavement. They are a public health and safety issue and have been ignored for several weeks by bin collectors. I would be grateful if they could please be removed from the vicinity as they are attracting litter dumping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Colomb Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
